tournament.name: MTG China Open S10 Regional Championship

decks.notes: The deck focuses on using cheap artifacts to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. It also includes disruptive elements like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt to control the opponent's resources. Urza's Saga is used to tutor for key artifacts like Mox Opal and Mishra's Bauble, while Metallic Rebuke provides additional disruption. The deck aims to win through a combination of early aggression and disruption, utilizing the synergy between artifacts to create a powerful and versatile strategy.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with a mixture of powerful creatures and burn spells. Ajani, Guide of Souls, and Ragavan provide strong threats, while Phlage and Seasoned Pyromancer help generate card advantage. Ocelot Pride and Voice of Victory pump up the team, with Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment providing additional reach. Blood Moon and Static Prison disrupt opponents' mana bases, while Thraben Charm offers removal and protection. The mana base is streamlined for consistency, with Arena of Glory providing additional value. The goal is to overwhelm opponents quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on utilizing Allosaurus Rider's ability to cast for free by exiling creature cards from your hand. By using cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to tutor for key creatures like Ghalta, Griselbrand, or Atraxa, you can quickly assemble a powerful board presence. Disciple of Freyalise helps ramp up your mana production, while cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer provide protection for your combo. Planar Genesis can help to reset the game if needed, while cards like Consign to Memory provide additional utility. The deck aims to combo off quickly and overwhelm your opponent.

The key concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. By playing efficient creatures like Ragavan and Ocelot Pride alongside powerful removal like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, this deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. Additional support from Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Seasoned Pyromancer helps generate card advantage and keep up the pressure. With cards like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to close out games swiftly and decisively.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to cast powerful spells and creatures, utilizing the synergy between Amulet of Vigor and the land cards to generate extra mana. The main win condition is to tutor for Primeval Titan using cards like Summoner's Pact and Green Sun's Zenith, then utilizing its ability to search for lands like Urza's Saga and Crumbling Vestige to create a powerful board state. There are also alternate win conditions with cards like Scapeshift and Malevolent Rumble. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and efficient combo.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride, while also using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to deal direct damage to the opponent or remove threats. The inclusion of Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Voice of Victory provides additional support for the aggro strategy, while cards like Blood Moon and Thraben Charm help control the battlefield and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The primary focus of this deck is to efficiently reanimate key creatures like Griselbrand using powerful instant spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. The inclusion of cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Psychic Frog helps control the game while setting up for the combo finish. Thoughtseize and Force of Negation function as disruption to protect the combo, with a mix of removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending to deal with threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements while including utility lands like Meticulous Archive and Undercity Sewers.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost artifacts to quickly establish a board presence while disrupting opponent's strategies with cards like Tormod's Crypt and Metallic Rebuke. Engineered Explosives can act as a board wipe if needed, while Urza's Saga helps search for key artifact pieces. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells, while also utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thoughtcast to generate card advantage. Weapons Manufacturing and Shadowspear provide additional ways to enhance creatures and push for damage quickly.

The key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells while utilizing Leylines to maximize the power of multicolored spells. The deck aims to quickly establish board presence with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending. The inclusion of Leyline binding and Leyline of the Guildpact allows for additional protection and power boost for the deck's spells. Ultimately, the deck seeks to apply constant pressure and close out the game swiftly.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of powerful removal spells, counterspells, and card advantage engines. It also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The win condition of the deck is to eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury or Thundertrap Trainer. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure that the deck can consistently cast its spells and activate its abilities.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's plans while building up a board presence of aggressive creatures. By utilizing powerful removal spells, control elements, and disruptive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phage, Titan of Fire's Fury, you can keep your opponent on the back foot while steadily wearing them down. With a mix of control and aggro elements, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and out-value your opponent through strategic plays and efficient creature-based threats.

This deck focuses on quickly establishing board presence with aggressive creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with targeted removal and disruptive spells. It aims to pressure the opponent's life total while also disrupting their resources and tempo with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory. The deck also includes a mix of value-generating cards like Quantum Riddler and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to outpace the opponent and maintain card advantage. Additionally, the deck utilizes a range of powerful lands to support its game plan and provide flexibility in its mana base.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with a combination of artifacts and efficient creatures. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Opal to generate mana and draw cards, as well as cards like Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer to put pressure on the opponent, this deck aims to close out games quickly. Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt provide disruption against opposing strategies, while Urza's Saga helps to tutor for key artifacts and generate additional threats. The deck's synergy between artifacts and creatures allows for explosive and aggressive plays.

This deck aims to quickly generate mana through rituals and medallions to cast spells like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Grapeshot to deal massive damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Past in Flames to recast instants and sorceries from the graveyard, while also having options like Valakut Awakening for card draw and Wish for flexible access to sideboard options. The deck also includes ways to dig for combo pieces with Reckless Impulse and Glimpse the Impossible, making it a fast and explosive Combo - Ruby Storm archetype in Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's plays through a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage engines. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy by countering key spells, removing threats from the board, and continuously drawing cards to stay ahead in resources. The deck also utilizes planeswalkers like Narset and Teferi to further control the game and ultimately win through attrition. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while also providing utility lands for additional card advantage or tempo advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of creatures with different abilities to create powerful synergies and combos that disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up your own resources. Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Malevolent Rumble provide removal and disruption, while Grist, the Hunger Tide and Yawgmoth, Thran Physician generate value through sacrificing creatures. The deck also includes tools like Dredger's Insight and Spymaster's Vault to search for key cards and maintain card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with its toolbox of creatures and combo potential.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of disruptive spells, powerful creatures, and versatile planeswalkers. It utilizes a mix of countermagic, removal, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating value and advantage for itself. The deck also has access to powerful finishers like Elesh Norn and Omnath to close out the game quickly once it has established control. Overall, the key concept of the deck is to disrupt, control, and ultimately dominate the game through a variety of powerful and synergistic cards.

The deck revolves around assembling the Amulet Titan combo, which involves using Amulet of Vigor to generate extra mana from bounce lands like Simic Growth Chamber. This allows for explosive plays with Primeval Titan to search for utility lands like Urza's Saga or strong finishers like Boseiju, Who Endures. The deck also includes cards like Scapeshift and Green Sun's Zenith to further support the combo strategy. By utilizing the synergy between land ramp, extra land drops, and powerful threats, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents and win through a combination of ramp and combo pieces.

The main idea behind this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful spells. With a focus on creature synergy and quick damage output, the deck aims to control the board and push through damage quickly. Cards like Ajani, Phlage, and Ragavan provide strong threats, while support cards like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment help clear the way for attacks. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Voice of Victory add versatility and disruption to the deck, giving it multiple avenues for victory.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly to the opponent. It includes powerful threats like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, backed up by support cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls. The inclusion of cards like Goblin Bombardment and Solitude allow for additional removal options, while cards like Voice of Victory and Witch Enchanter provide additional utility. The mana base includes cards like Arid Mesa and Flooded Strand to ensure consistent mana production for the aggressive strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with relentless attacks and damage.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive plays, utilizing a combination of powerful creatures like Ocelot Pride and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, along with burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to finish off opponents swiftly. Cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer provide additional value and pressure. Static Prison and Thraben Charm help to control the board while Arena of Glory buffs up the team. The deck also includes utility lands like Flooded Strand and Elegant Parlor to support its strategy of overwhelming the opponent with fast, efficient threats.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and supporting them with burn spells and disruption. The strategy is to apply constant pressure on the opponent, utilizing cards like Guide of Souls and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer to deal damage early on. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride provide additional aggression, while cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Voice of Victory offer card advantage and resilience. The deck also includes removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm, along with disruptive elements like Blood Moon and Static Prison to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan while establishing card advantage and tempo. It utilizes a combination of efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Counterspell, hand disruption with Thoughtseize, and powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to close out the game. The deck also includes cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety to protect its own threats and disrupt the opponent's strategies. With a focus on control and manipulation, this deck aims to outsmart and outlast the opponent.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and removal. It also utilizes creatures and planeswalkers to control the board and generate card advantage. The deck aims to control the tempo of the game, gradually wearing down the opponent's resources while establishing a dominant position on the battlefield. The mana base is designed to support the control elements of the deck and enable consistent card draw and disruption.

Utilizing Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells, this deck aims to control the game by quickly ramping into powerful threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. With access to cards like Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble, the deck can disrupt opponents' strategies while establishing a dominant board presence. The inclusion of cards like Sire of Seven Deaths and Ugin, Eye of the Storms provides additional control options and win conditions. Overall, the deck focuses on using ramp and control elements to overwhelm opponents with powerful Eldrazi creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Elesh Norn, Griselbrand, and Atraxa using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. By utilizing instant speed reanimation combined with disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation, the deck aims to control the game while setting up its combo pieces. Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog add additional utility and card advantage to the deck, allowing for consistent access to key pieces. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements while also providing flexibility in fetching necessary lands.

The deck focuses on quickly getting creatures like Griselbrand and Superior Spider-Man into the graveyard, then using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring them back onto the battlefield for powerful combos. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize to control the game and protect the combo. The deck aims to win quickly by reanimating big threats while disrupting opponents' game plans. The mana base includes fetch lands and a variety of colors to support the deck's diverse card requirements.

The focus of this deck is to aggressively disrupt opponents' game plans while deploying threats that can close out the game quickly. By utilizing a mix of disruptive elements like Teferi, Time Raveler and Consign to Memory, along with efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Solitude, the deck aims to control the board and pressure opponents. The inclusion of cards like Quantum Riddler and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provides additional ways to disrupt the opponent, while cards like Lightning Bolt offer direct damage and removal. The mana base is tailored to support the deck's aggressive game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly and aggressively playing out artifacts and creatures to overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble, Mox Opal, and Urza's Saga, the deck can generate fast mana and card advantage. This allows for explosive starts and the ability to quickly establish a threatening board presence. The inclusion of disruptive elements like Engineered Explosives and Tormod's Crypt helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining pressure. With a mix of proactive threats and disruptive elements, the deck aims to close out games quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on playing multiple spells in a turn to generate mana and tempo advantage, while disrupting the opponent's plans. By utilizing cheap spells like Birthing Ritual and Sink into Stupor, the deck can quickly ramp up and deploy threats like Abhorrent Oculus and Ice-Fang Coatl. The inclusion of cards like Force of Negation and Flare of Denial helps to protect the board and maintain control. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures, disruption, and tempo plays, ultimately securing victory through a fast and aggressive strategy.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Monastery Swiftspear while using spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to control the board and deal damage to the opponent. The deck also plays cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to help filter through the deck and find the necessary cards to keep applying pressure. With a mix of burn spells and efficient creatures, the Temur Aggro archetype aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent and secure a fast victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by ramping up mana quickly with the Urza lands (UrzaTron) and using powerful colorless spells and abilities to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to dominate the battlefield with Ugin, Eye of the Storms and Karn, the Great Creator, while also utilizing cards like All Is Dust and Kozilek's Command for board control. The deck also includes a few Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End for additional threats, and uses artifacts like Expedition Map and Talisman of Curiosity to ensure efficient mana production and card advantage.
